bioghist.p: Elizabeth Grill Watson (1914-2006) was a freelance writer, speaker, and workshop leader, with particular interests in liberation, feminist, and creation theology. Watson received her bachelor's degree in English literature and Greek from Miami University, and later studied theology at Chicago Theological Seminary and the University of Chicago Divinity School before discovering the Society of Friends and becoming a Quaker. In 1937, she married George Watson. Elizabeth Watson is the author of several books, including Guests of My Life and Wisdom's Daughters, a book about women of the New Testament.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Elizabeth Watson. Materials include personal and professional correspondence, including copies of George and Elizabeth Watson's "yearly letters" from 1937 to 2004; drafts of writings and speeches; manuscripts of And Many Others and Wisdom's Daughters; photo albums with journal entries from Watson's trips abroad; journals and diaries; scrapbooks related to the publication of her books, including correspondence from readers, reviews, and publicity material; and audio tapes of Watson's talks.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
